title: Kelly Slater and his friends have built the greatest man-made wave ever | For The Win
text: The man-made wave is something that’s been a staple at water parks for years, but it was a gimmick, something for kids and tourists and never viewed as a real substitute for high-level surfers. Kelly Slater has spent the last decade with a team working on creating an artificial wave that manages to approximate the real thrill of surfing. It looks like they got there. If not there, then really, really close.  The video doesn’t go into much detail about how the wave is created, but for now, it’s cool to know they’ve done it. This will change the game in surfing, in how the greats can train. No matter the swell or weather conditions, they will have a wave. This is amazing.  Slater was eliminated from Billabong Pipe Masters on Thursday by Mick Fanning in the quarterfinals, but he’ll take “created the greatest man-made wave ever” as a consolation I’m sure.
